critique: This document is an executive order transferring jurisdiction of land from a bird refuge to the Navy Department. It was issued in 1940. Given the historical context of 1940, with World War II looming, the transfer of land to the Navy Department suggests a prioritization of national security. There is no information to suggest any ideological tilt. The order does not directly address immigration. The order shifts control of the land, which could be seen as expanding executive power, but it is a relatively minor shift. The order involves a shift from state to federal control. The order prioritizes national security. The order does not directly address economic regulation. The order does not directly address social inclusion.
